meanings.definition: The state or quality of being vaporous.
meanings.sent1: The vaporousnesses of the mist created a dreamy atmosphere in the forest.
meanings.sent2: The morning dew quickly disappeared, demonstrating its vaporousnesses.
meanings.sent3: The magician's trick relied on the vaporousnesses of the disappearing act.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts floated away like vaporousnesses in the wind.
meanings.sent5: The ethereal vaporousnesses of the clouds painted a beautiful sky.

meanings.definition: The tendency to evaporate or become vapor.
meanings.sent1: The heat caused the rapid vaporousnesses of the puddles on the sidewalk.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the vaporousnesses of different liquids under varying temperatures.
meanings.sent3: The chef's recipe called for the vaporousnesses of the alcohol to enhance the flavor.
meanings.sent4: The morning mist lifted with the vaporousnesses of the rising sun.
meanings.sent5: The steam rising from the kettle showed the vaporousnesses of boiling water.

meanings.definition: The quality of being insubstantial or lacking in substance.
meanings.sent1: The artist captured the vaporousnesses of the ghostly figure in the painting.
meanings.sent2: The philosopher pondered the vaporousnesses of existence and reality.
meanings.sent3: The student's excuse had the vaporousnesses of a poorly constructed lie.
meanings.sent4: The promise of eternal love turned out to be mere vaporousnesses.
meanings.sent5: The politician's words were full of empty vaporousnesses, lacking any real meaning.
